test_cases.test_name: Serialization and Aggregation Workflow Configuration Test
test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly configures serialization and aggregation workflows using the vendor's configuration studio.
prerequisites: Vendor configuration studio is installed and accessible
Packaging line hardware is connected and operational
User has administrative privileges for configuration

test_steps.action: Log into the vendor configuration studio with admin credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and gains access to the configuration studio.

test_steps.action: Configure a new packaging line workflow with station roles and verification steps.
test_steps.expected_result: Workflow is saved without errors and station roles are correctly assigned.

test_steps.action: Simulate a rework flow with reason capture and verify the configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: Rework flow is functional and reason capture is recorded in the audit trail.

acceptance_criteria: Workflow configuration is saved and retrievable without errors
Station roles and verification steps are correctly applied
Rework flow captures and stores reasons as required
data_integrity_requirements: All configuration changes must be logged in the audit trail
No unauthorized modifications to workflows are permitted

test_cases.objective: Ensure the system correctly generates and transmits regulatory EPCIS events for shipments as per compliance requirements.
prerequisites: EPCIS event generation is configured in the system
Integration with external partners is set up

test_steps.action: Create a test shipment in the system with serialized units and aggregated cases.
test_steps.expected_result: Shipment is created and serialization/aggregation data is stored.

test_steps.action: Trigger EPCIS event generation for the test shipment.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS events are generated and stored in the system.

test_steps.action: Verify EPCIS events are transmitted to the configured partner systems.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS events are successfully transmitted and acknowledged by partners.

acceptance_criteria: EPCIS events are generated for all required shipment events
Events contain all mandatory data fields as per regulatory requirements
Events are successfully transmitted to partner systems
data_integrity_requirements: EPCIS events must be immutable once generated
All transmissions must be logged with timestamps and status

test_cases.objective: To ensure that the packaging line workflows are correctly configured with station roles and verification processes.

test_steps.action: Access the vendor configuration studio and navigate to the packaging line workflow settings.
test_steps.expected_result: The packaging line workflow settings are accessible and configurable.

test_steps.action: Configure station roles and verification processes for the packaging line.
test_steps.expected_result: Station roles and verification processes are correctly configured and saved.

test_steps.action: Simulate a packaging line workflow with the configured settings.
test_steps.expected_result: The workflow executes as expected with proper station roles and verification.

acceptance_criteria: Packaging line workflows are correctly configured and verified.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all configuration changes are logged and traceable.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the system correctly generates regulatory EPCIS events for shipments.
prerequisites: Access to EPCIS event generation module

test_steps.action: Access the EPCIS event generation module in the system.
test_steps.expected_result: The EPCIS event generation module is accessible and functional.

test_steps.action: Input sample shipment data into the EPCIS event generation module.
test_steps.expected_result: The system accepts the sample shipment data and processes it.

test_steps.action: Generate EPCIS events for the sample shipment data.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS events are correctly generated and formatted according to regulatory standards.

acceptance_criteria: EPCIS events are generated correctly and comply with regulatory standards.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all EPCIS events are accurately logged and traceable.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the serialization workflow is correctly configured according to URS-024-001 and URS-024-002.
prerequisites: Test packaging line setup is available

test_steps.action: Access the vendor configuration studio and load the serialization workflow.
test_steps.expected_result: Workflow configuration is displayed without errors.

test_steps.action: Simulate a packaging line workflow with station roles and verification.
test_steps.expected_result: Workflow executes as configured with proper station roles and verification.

test_steps.action: Trigger a rework flow and capture the reason for rework.
test_steps.expected_result: Rework flow is executed and reason is captured in the audit trail.

acceptance_criteria: Serialization workflow executes without errors.
Station roles and verification are correctly applied.
Rework reason is captured in the audit trail.
data_integrity_requirements: All serial events must be logged in the audit trail.
Rework reasons must be accurately recorded.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly generates and exchanges EPCIS events for regulatory compliance as per URS-024-005 and URS-024-011.

test_steps.action: Configure a test shipment in the system and trigger EPCIS event generation.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS events are generated for the shipment.

test_steps.action: Verify the EPCIS events are correctly formatted and contain all required data.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS events meet regulatory standards and include all mandatory fields.

test_steps.action: Simulate EPCIS event exchange with a partner endpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS events are successfully transmitted and acknowledged by the partner.

acceptance_criteria: EPCIS events are generated for each shipment.
EPCIS events comply with regulatory standards.
EPCIS events are successfully exchanged with partners.
data_integrity_requirements: EPCIS events must be accurately generated and logged.
All regulatory data fields must be included.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the configured serialization workflows correctly handle unit-level serialization and aggregation as per URS-024-001 and URS-024-002.
prerequisites: Test serial numbers and aggregation data available

test_steps.action: Configure a test packaging line workflow with station roles and verification steps.
test_steps.expected_result: Workflow configuration is saved without errors and station roles are correctly assigned.

test_steps.action: Simulate a rework flow with reason capture and verify the system behavior.
test_steps.expected_result: Rework flow is executed correctly, and the reason for rework is captured in the audit trail.

acceptance_criteria: Workflow configuration matches URS-024-001 requirements
Rework flow captures reasons as per URS-024-002
data_integrity_requirements: All serialization events must be logged and traceable

test_cases.objective: Validate that the serialization system meets the performance requirements of 300 UPH with zero missed scans and latency under 100 ms per scan as per URS-024-008 and URS-024-009.

test_steps.action: Simulate a high-volume scan scenario with 300 units per hour.
test_steps.expected_result: System processes all scans without missing any and maintains latency below 100 ms per scan.

test_steps.action: Monitor system performance during peak load and verify OEE dashboards.
test_steps.expected_result: OEE dashboards accurately reflect system performance and exception rates.

acceptance_criteria: System achieves 300 UPH with zero missed scans
Latency per scan remains under 100 ms
data_integrity_requirements: All scan events must be accurately recorded and timestamped

test_cases.objective: To ensure that the packaging line workflows are correctly configured with station roles and verification processes as per URS-024-001.

test_steps.action: Log in to the vendor configuration studio and navigate to the packaging line workflow settings.
test_steps.expected_result: Packaging line workflow settings are accessible and displayed correctly.

test_steps.action: Configure station roles and verification processes for each packaging line station.
test_steps.expected_result: Station roles and verification processes are configured accurately as per the requirements.

acceptance_criteria: All station roles and verification processes are correctly configured and functional.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all configurations are saved and logged in the audit trail.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the system correctly generates regulatory EPCIS events for shipments as per URS-024-005.
prerequisites: Access to EPCIS event generation module

test_steps.action: Simulate a shipment process and trigger EPCIS event generation.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS events are generated and logged correctly.

test_steps.action: Verify the generated EPCIS events against regulatory requirements.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS events comply with DSCSA and EU FMD regulations.

acceptance_criteria: All EPCIS events are generated and comply with regulatory requirements.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all EPCIS events are accurately logged and traceable.

test_cases.test_name: Serialization and Aggregation Workflow Configuration Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the configured workflows for unit-level serialization and aggregation function as intended.
prerequisites: System configuration completed as per URS-024
Test environment with packaging line simulation

test_steps.action: Initiate a simulated packaging line workflow with unit-level serialization.
test_steps.expected_result: Units are serialized correctly according to configured rules.

test_steps.action: Proceed to case aggregation and verify the aggregation process.
test_steps.expected_result: Cases are aggregated correctly with parent-child relationships maintained.

test_steps.action: Simulate a rework flow and capture the reason for rework.
test_steps.expected_result: Rework flow is executed, and the reason is logged in the audit trail.

acceptance_criteria: All serialization and aggregation steps complete without errors.
Rework reasons are captured and stored in the audit trail.
data_integrity_requirements: All serialization events must be logged with timestamps.
Parent-child relationships must be accurately maintained.

test_cases.test_name: Regulatory EPCIS Event Generation and Integration Test
test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly generates and transmits EPCIS events for regulatory compliance.
prerequisites: Test partner system available for EPCIS exchange

test_steps.action: Simulate a shipment event in the system.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS event for the shipment is generated.

test_steps.action: Transmit the EPCIS event to the test partner system.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS event is successfully transmitted and acknowledged.

test_steps.action: Verify the EPCIS event content against regulatory requirements.
test_steps.expected_result: EPCIS event contains all required fields for DSCSA/EU FMD compliance.

acceptance_criteria: EPCIS events are generated and transmitted without errors.
EPCIS event content meets all regulatory requirements.
data_integrity_requirements: EPCIS events must be immutable once generated.
All transmitted events must be logged with acknowledgments.
